dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: SABU makes a furtive EXCHANGE with a young BLACK KID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone sees what Cy's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: You want a hand? cy (tossing Tyrone KEYS) No... go on up. I been kicking his narrow ass since high school. Cy trots across the street. A WHITE GIRL walks his way

dialogues.speaker: WHITE GIRL
dialogues.text: What you got to sell? cy (rolling his eyes) Lady, every Black man you lay eyes on ain't a dope dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone waits inside the messy apartment. Suddenly he spot JUDGE'S CLOTHES hanging over a chair. A moment passes. Th Tyrone, begins RIFLING through a pair PANTS. He checks Judge's WALLET. Pulling out a DRIVER'S LICENSE, Tyrone's finger traces the EXPIRATION DATE: 5/20/69.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (to himself) "My license was expired" Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy's got SABU against the wall, hissing into his face. cy I ain't gonna tell you no more. No pushing in the neighborhood, especially not on my fucking street. You're killing your own people asshole.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Man, fuck you!!! cy No Fuck you!!! Cy SLUGS Sabu hard in the gut, dropping him to the ground cy I ain't playing Sabu. You keep on like this and I'm going to bust you up. Shaking his head in disgust, Cy heads toward home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his belly, Sabu catches his breath. SHOES appear front of him, shiny COP SHOES. It's SGT. SCHRECK.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Aww man...

dialogues.speaker: SCHRECK
dialogues.text: Those Panthers are turning into real shitheels ain't they... Schreck REACHES DOWN, helping Sabu. Sabu's amazed at the "Good Cop" routine.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're motherfuckers, all high and mighty.

dialogues.speaker: SCHRECK
dialogues.text: You shouldn't take that. If I was you... (an edge of violence) I'd stand up for myself, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CY looks around the empty space. cy Tyrone? Shit, where'd you go?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room filled with all the PANTHERS and more than a few NEW FACES, Huey stands at the podium, filled with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Look around you, brothers and sisters, we're building the numbers. New members coming in almost every day. I'd like to introduce one of them. He's is the author of "Soul on Ice," a respected journalist and I'm proud to say the newly appointed Minister of Information for the Black Panther Party. Brothers and sisters, Eldridge Cleaver. Applause rises as the tall, black man from before, still wear SUNGLASSES, strides to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brothers and Sisters! You are all well aware of the chains that we as a people bear. The chains of slavery, of second class citizenship. But there are other, more invisible chains. The chains of not speaking your mind. The chains of all the words left unsaid out of fear of reprisal by The Man. The silencing of our Black voices. I'm here to tell you that we have a voice. (a smile) And I'd like to prove to you. All of you, repeat after me. SILENCE fills the room, everyone hangs on Eldridge's word

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Fuck Ronald Reagan. Smiles hit the assembled faces. Judge chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: I'm serious. Repeat after me. Fuck Ronald Reagan.

dialogues.speaker: ASSEMBLY
dialogues.text: Fuck Ronald Reagan!!!

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Feels good don't it. Amazing how  saying your mind can free your soul.

dialogues.speaker: ASSEMBLY
dialogues.text: Fuck Ronald Reagan!! Powerful and playful, the CHANT course through the room. Everyone's SMILING, reveling in the camaraderie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting over, Huey, Judge and Tyrone watch the room clear Tyrone's EDGY, trying to get Huey alone.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Huey man I got to talk with you...

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: So talk...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (looking at Judge) Alone...

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Look... can we deal with this tomorrow... I'm tired... Huey walks away, leaving Tyrone glaring at Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun streams through the girders, shining its light equall on both sides of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset and in deeper than he ever expected, Judge smacks t dashboard in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Listen Judge, Oakland's Panther International Headquarters. We shut the Pig's infiltration down here, they're gonna think twice about running their games on other chapters.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Huey, man who's gonna straighten out the brothers if they get on my ass?

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Like the manual says, "Information is...

dialogues.speaker: HUEY AND JUDGE
dialogues.text: (in unison) disseminated on a need-to-know basis."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what I need to know, is what exactly your gonna do about feeding the pigs a bust?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: I don't know man. I don't know. That reminds me. (passing an ENVELOPE to Huey) Another little donation from the police.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: If the pigs only knew they were subsidizing The Panthers...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yeah well, they want a lot for their money. They want a felony, preferably with "violent intent." We've got to give them something. They'll kill me if I don't. And the Panthers are going to kill me if I do. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Me too. That's why I fight so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's CHANGED in the neighborhood, the Panther pres seems to have given the street focus. Folks gather nearby hanging enjoying the sunshine. Bo Diddley's "Oh Baby" grooves from a radio. CY -- amped on the movement -- walks out of the PANTHER H He runs into JUDGE out on the street. cy Hey, it's the invisible man. Brother where you been?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (gripping Cy's hand) Cy... I ain't even sure. cy C'mon we'll walk and talk...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (pointing inside) Naw... I gotta... cy I hear you. I'll catch you in a bit.  Feeling cooped up in there, you know? Cy steps out into Grove street. Judge WATCHES him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy cruises the street. People check out the UNIFORM, some even offer up a "Right on." or flash the fist salute. ROSE -- staked out on his steps -- beckons Cy over.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Hey... Cy... what now you a righteous Panther man, you too uppity to drink with us? cy You know that's bullshit. Rose passes him the BOTTLE, Cy takes a small swig. Immedi his FACE PUCKERS. cy Aaaah, Bitter Motherfucker... I almost forgot how nasty that shit is.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well don't go forgetting your friends. cy (leaving) Ain't gonna happen, stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You know it. Stay Black... cy Damn straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding a corner Cy spots SABU -- yep, he's still dealin Rolling his eyes, Cy steps toward him. cy I swear, you gotta be a card-carrying member of the stupid revolution. Sabu's SCARED, he backs away from Cy. Customers SCATTER.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Motherfucker... you stay away... cy Look this is bull... Dumb, cowardly, SABU comes up with a PISTOL. He FIRES it into Cy, not even aiming, just fear pulling a trigger. O Twice, Three times. Cy takes a PAIR of BULLETS straight to the chest. Blood f his surprised face. cy (amazed) +..shit... Cy COLLAPSES onto the pavement as SABU runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in the main room, Judge works a MIMEOGRAPH MACHINE, running off more Ten Point Programs. TYRONE comes in through the back door, startling Judge.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: C'mere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter has an obviously terrified YOUNG PANTHER up agains the wall as Judge and Tyrone step into the half light.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Signed up ‘bout a month ago. Says his name's Matty. I call him spy! Wham!! Tyrone SLUGS Matty right in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Motherfucker gave the pigs the license numbers of every Panther car. Tyrone grabs Matty's INDEX FINGER.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (to Matty) This the finger you ratted on us with? CRACK!! Tyrone jerks Matty's finger back BREAKING IT. Repulsed, Judge turns back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone bolts in after Judge.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What? You don't like to see a traitor get hurt? I wonder why that is?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: If you got something to say, say it.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Anything happens to Huey it ain't gonna be a finger. I'll... GENE -- eyes lit up with anger and fear -- bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: It's Cy... he's been shot. Bam! Judge SNAPS pushing Tyrone away and bolting out the door. Tyrone follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy WRITHES in agony on the pavement, in a pool of blood. Judge kneels down next to him, cradling him. Cy's COUGHIN trying to talk.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Cy... Cy... Oh shit man... who did this to you. Was it the pigs? cy N... Not... Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy DIES right there in Judge's arms. Something twists in Judge's heart, the struggle has just become very personal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shirt covered with his dead friend's blood, Judge sit at the table, destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers... Judge grabs the phone, punching out a number.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Inspector Brimmer

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Judge, hold on, is your phone safe?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Who fucking cares? You cops killed Cy. And before you bastards kill anyone else, I'll give you your fucking set up. That make you happy                        !

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Judge, calm down. Judge grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: I'm calm. I'm calm. You just shut the fuck up. And listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PANTHER VAN heads down the road, sticking out like a sore thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: Through the windshield of a police vehicle. The VAN crosses the screen right to left. Starting forward, the p car following at a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYRONE'S driving as Judge sits -- preoccupied -- in the passenger seat. Suspicion hovers between the two. GENE's back next to a load of NEWSPAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (eyeing Judge) What's up with you?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: You got something on your mind... "brother."

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, "brother" My best friend is stone dead. The words cool Tyrone off a bit.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Sorry man...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: S'alright. I'm sorry too. Shit, I gotta take a leak... Pull over at that gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VAN pulls into the TINY station. Judge's hops out hea inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIMMER watches the scene through BINOCULARS. He hisses i a WALKIE TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: It's going down... Right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER MAN sits placidly behind the counter as Judge en the door ringing a BELL.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: If you want gas my nephew...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Where's your bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Out back. Judge stands, stock still, sweating. The Man cocks his he strangely. Adrenaline raging, Judge PULLS a GUN.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Open the god damn register! !!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impatient Tyrone drums his fingers on the dash.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: How long can a piss take? Gene SHRUGS.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Hey... I got one for ya. Two brothers are taking a leak off the Bay Bridge. First one says, "Damn, this water's cold." Other one just smiles and goes, "Yeah and deep too." Tyrone CHUCKLES, suddenly his face DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS LIGHTS. Half a dozen POLICE CARS swoop down on the filling station.  Fast, like storm troopers, the cops pull TYRONE and GENE from the van, roughing them up.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (pushing through) Watch the faces Goddamit!! We want them recognizable... Tyrone SHOVES a cop away from him. Brimmer DRAWS his .38, training it calmly between Tyrone's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Easy boy... Or I will blow you right away...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (putting up his hands) We haven't done nothing! Why don't you fascist pigs stop harassing us?

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Harassment my ass, pal. You just stuck up this station. We got a witness...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What kind of bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: I'll go get the other one.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: No!!! Get the bastards cuffed, I got him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer dashes around the corner. He bangs on the BATHROO DOOR. Nothing. He puts his mouth to the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) It's me Brimmer. Get the fuck out of here. Judge BOLTS out of the toilet. Brimmer FIRES over his hea Judge runs fast through the weeds, up the hill. THE ROOKIE COP sprints around the corner, AIMING at Judge Brimmer BUMPS him. The shot fires wide. Judge DISAPPEARS over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTERS swarm the steps. DORSETT, basking in the camera glow, smugly addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's arrest exposes the Black Panthers for what they truly are... common criminals. Yes, we have a group of the so called revolutionaries in custody right now. Caught red handed robbing a local business. And as soon as our witness gives us a positive identification, we'll file charges of armed robbery with intent to kill...

dialogues.speaker: NEWSMAN
dialogues.text: Sir... was anybody hurt?

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: (turning back inside) I have no further comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flushed with victory, Dorsett strides into his office. Pi Rodgers looks up from a TELETYPE.

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: I want it duly noted, that this operation was entirely under the auspices of the Oakland Police Department. The FBI doesn't have a monopoly on agents infiltrating enemy organizations, my friend. As I've said before, Agent Rodgers, we have things under control in our city...

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Are you finished?

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: No I'm not. I'd like to say, frankly and off the record, that I resent the Bureau's presence here. "Advisory Basis" or not. And, once we get these boys put away and the Panthers permanently discredited, I'd appreciate it if you'd leave us to take care of our own. Now I'm finished. Rodgers fixes Dorsett with a stony glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast, head down, JUDGE moves through Oakland's skid row, heading for an ABANDONED GARAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually the line up room is two chambers. Dorsett and R enter the smaller room. BRIMMER, haggard, smoking, beckon Dorsett to a corner. Rodgers sticks by the door. Brimmer WHISPERS to Dorsett, we can't hear the conversati but obviously The Chief doesn't like it. In the FOREGROUND, THE MAN from the gas station stands in front of TWO WAY GLASS -- A UNIFORM cop at his side. TYRONE AND GENE stand on the line up platform on the oppo side of the two way glass. Dorsett and Brimmer move to the man. We see now that he's staring blankly at the Panthers.

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: Brimmer, what are you telling me? The uniform cop WAVES his hand in front of the man's face

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: He's blind chief. Couldn't I.D. his own mother.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) He just stands in for his nephew during lunch. Dorsett TURNS, locking eyes with Rodgers. Fixing Dorsett with a WITHERING GLARE, Rodgers walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's place -- the back of a chop shop -- is a forest of BOTTLES and CAR SEATS. An OLD TV blares a NEWSCAST: "Pant Freed" complete with a PHOTO of Tyrone and Gene.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: This cool the heat off you any?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: I don't know. (rising) But I'm sure I'll find out. Rose, you did me solid. Judge PULLS some BILLS from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Unh... Unh Man... I don't take no money from friends that need help. Fuck no. What do you think I ama bum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. (gripping Rose's hand) I'll catch you later. Rose -- something big on his mind -- STOPS Judge at the d

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Judge... I... I shoulda told you this before but... well... fuck...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It was Sabu killed Cy.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Where is he?.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Ain't no one seen him.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Didn't want folks to think I was a snitch. You know? PAIN creases Judge's face.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (softly) Yeah man... I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Panthers are celebrating. TYRONE and the others relea while the paper gets printed. BOB DYLAN's "Ballad of a Th Man" PLAYS. Huey, wine in one hand, grooves to the music

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: (to Tyrone) Shit... check this out.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: (over) ...something is happening here...

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: But you don't know what it is Mr Jones. See Dylan is hip. The part about the geeks getting the worst jobs, that's like us, man. Black folks always get given the lowest shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with purpose) Yeah man, but where's Judge?

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: (pointedly) You know I think Brother Judge needs our support right now, not our suspicion (picking up paper off the press) This is beautiful man. Folks around here never read the truth like this before. TYRONE is just about to speak, when ELDRIDGE who's been bustling around escorts Huey into a basket chair, replaci his wine glass and paper with a spear and rifle. Tyrone s after them as ALMA comes over.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: El Rage what's with all the Zulu shit?

dialogues.speaker: ELRIDGE
dialogues.text: We can no longer let the white media control our image. We gotta let the people know what we are about ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: That's what our newspaper will do.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: But lots of our people don't read, man. They need strong imagery to help them out.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Yeah... then shouldn't this be all of us together.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: (propping up a shield) Trust me Huey, this picture will be worth a thousand words. Now have you given any thought to that Peace and Freedom Party thing. They really want to hook up with us. Do a rally together. Hell it'd broaden our base of visibility.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but aligning with white organizations. I'm not sure now's the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time, my friend, is what Sartre called, "the moment the match is being put to the fuse." Question is, is the hand holding that match gonna be black or white.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: ...no full fledge alliance. But I think we should do a rally with them. Show that there's some common ground between Black and White. You all with that? (everyone nods) All right then Eldridge, set it up.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: By far this is the largest rally we've seen. Police stand RIOT FORMATION as a HUGE CROWD looks up to a podium near center's steps.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Hell No! We won't go! Hell No! We won't go!!! HUEY, TYRONE, ALMA, ELDRIDGE and a contingent of Panthers hold precise formation at the side of the platform as AVA a sandy haired young man finishes his speech.

dialogues.speaker: AVAKIAN
dialogues.text: Not long ago, we came to these steps to protest. We were four thousand then. Tonight we are ten thousand. A HUGE ROAR rises from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JUDGE'S PLACE
dialogues.text: The ROAR continues over as Judge approaches his DOORWAY, CAR glides to the curb. BRIMMER -- eyes red-rimmed with h stares out. JUDGE BOLTS, running fast down an alleyway and turns the corner. Screeching tires, two uniformed cops in a SQUAD C blast out of nowhere, sealing the exit, weapons drawn. Brimmer PULLS UP on the curb. In seconds he's got Judge f down on the hood, CUFFED. Brimmer SMACKS Judge's head against the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot Motherfucker, that blind man was real cute. Brimmer drags Judge toward an ALLEY. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: AVAKIAN
dialogues.text: Ten thousand different voices. All unified, saying one thing. That you cannot have an imperialistic war abroad and social peace at home. So with that unity, that purpose in mind... Ladies and Gentlemen I give you the Minister of Defense of the Black Panther Party -- Huey Newton. APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Thank you. The Black Panther Party is proud to be here tonight. Here in front of this monument to oppression both at home and abroad. Not far from here, Brother Bobby Seale is locked down. Shouts go up, "Yeah Bobby!!" "Set the brother free!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer pushes Judge up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: (over) A victim of the tyranny we feel here at home.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: That same tyranny is at work many miles from here. In Vietnam. Black men are dying there, white men are dying there. Yellow men are dying there. We're told they're dying in the name of freedom. (a beat) Freedom. Well, now if their blood's keeping us free. How come so many of us -- like Bobby -- are in jail. If  they're dying so we can enjoy our rights, how come the police still kill us in the streets? Angry YELLS rise, agreeing with Huey. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer lays into Judge, hitting him in the gut. Defensel CUFFED, Judge takes each brutal punch.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: So, when you think about it. The question we have to ask is... Why should the Black man go fight the Yellow man for the White man? It's that simple. The answer's simple too. (a beat) We shouldn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS ringing out, Brimmer's hands work for pain.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: The Black Panther Party is opposed to the war in Vietnam! We know our war is here. Against hard drugs in the community. Against unemployment. Against a system that beats a Black man in his home, then sends him to die in a foreign land. That my brothers and sisters, is our war. Ten thousand unite in THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crumpled on the ground, Judge's doubled up in pain. Brimm UNCUFFS him and WALKS AWAY. Over, the APPLAUSE rises to a  deafening pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer stalks down the hall, unhappy. FBI guys in suits EVERYWHERE -- pulling teletypes, on the phones. They're l an occupying army.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (passing a doorway) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: (over) Brimmer! Could you come in here please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodgers has set himself up in a command center. Across fr him DORSETT sits like a whipped dog.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Sit down, This concerns you too. (pulls out a Black Panther newspaper) I don't need to say that your department's handling of the Black Panthers -- particularly Inspector Brimmer's "undercover operation" has been a complete travesty.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Just hold on a god damn minute. I... Ignoring Brimmer, Rodgers passes the PAPERS to Dorsett.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: These are memos from the commissioner, the mayor and Hoover himself, putting the Black Panthers and their subversive activities under the full jurisdiction of the Bureau.

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: (reading) Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: As far as Mr. Hoover is concerned the worst has happened, the Panthers have unified with other organizations -- most likely sponsored by communists -- to undermine the war in Vietnam. (a beat) By doing so, they have quite simply guaranteed their own extinction.  Rodgers studies Dorsett and Brimmer's incredulous faces.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Of course we welcome any cooperation the your department has to “offer...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimi Hendrix's “Machine Gun" plays as the cops move in fo the kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOMB crashes through the window. Yells, Chaos, Then an EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops BATTER down a door, storming the place. They BURN pa destroy FOOD for the breakfast program. It looks and feel like a modern day version of Kristalnacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYRONE and LITTLE BOBBY stand out front. A SQUAD CAR pass White faces gaze stonily at Black. A cop points his finge like a GUN at the Panthers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops SLAP NEWSPAPERS from Gene's hand, pushing him up aga the wall. coP What's your name punk?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: What?!?!?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Five!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene spins out his tale to HUEY. Jimi Hendrix plays in th background

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: And I keep saying "Five" like the fifth amendment you know? And shit this cop is getting pissed. But there  ain't much he can do... So... dig this, he gives me a ticket for littering, on account of the papers he ripped outta my hand. Huey notices “cherry tops" red glow in the rear view mirr

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: A SQUAD CAR sits, lights FLASHING, behind HUEY'S VOLKSWAG The belligerent BABY-FACED COP from the showdown on Grove Street -- settles his flashlight beam on HUEY. GENE, sitting next to Huey, looks very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: BABY FACED COP
dialogues.text: Well, well, well, what do we have here, the great Huey P. Newton... (a smile) Get out of the car. Huey holds up his LAW BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: (calmly and carefully) California law does not require the driver to leave a vehicle, unless he is being placed under arrest...

dialogues.speaker: BABY FACED COP
dialogues.text: Well, then you're under arrest get out of the car... Baby Face pulls his REVOLVER.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Huey... Huey moves out of the car very, very slowly -- his life depending on it.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: I am not resisting arrest. Nor am I armed. Any use of force on your part is illegal... (holding up BOOK) according to California...

dialogues.speaker: BABY FACED COP
dialogues.text: You can take that law book and shove it up your ass nigger... ANOTHER SQUAD CAR pulls up. A NERVOUS PATROLMAN gets out. His hand HOVERS over his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... whatcha got... Baby Face COCKS his .38. Huey stiffens. TENSION.

dialogues.speaker: BABY FACED COP
dialogues.text: Buddy, we just got ourselves a promotion. There's a SOUND, GENE'S getting out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: BABY FACED COP
dialogues.text: You!!! Get the fuck back in... (moves the gun) GUNFIRE rings out. Hitting Huey in the gut. BABY FACE, al wounded, drops. The NERVOUS COP has freaked out and is shooting wildly. Bleeding HUEY crawls toward BABY FACE'S GUN. He grabs it, turning it on the NERVOUS COP. MORE GUNFIRE. Chaos. Screaming. Splattered with BLOOD, TH LAW BOOK lies on the ground, bearing an inscription on th flyleaf: HUEY P. NEWTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huey's HANDCUFFED to a GURNEY, being wheeled fast through the hall. I.V.'s hang. Blood is everywhere. COPS hover malevolently over his spread-eagled form. Cops COVER HUEY'S FACE with a towel, then start viciously BEATING HUEY. Doctors and Nurses look on impotently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears streak Alma's face. TYRONE, JUDGE and the other Pan sit solemnly. NEWSPAPERS cover every surface blaring: COP SLAIN PANTHER LEADER WOUNDED IN SHOOT-OUT. In the background, Panthers put Huey's WICKER CHAIR poste in the window. Eldridge's got his ear glued to a PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: (to the others) The pigs are going for Murder one...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Right with Bobby getting out, they try to put Huey in the gas chamber... Damn.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: Please Huey stay alive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a MOS sequence, JACKSON a Black Trustee leads Bobby Se dressed in STREET CLOTHES -- down the windy halls. Bobby holds a FILE of RELEASE PAPERS. Seale comes to the doorway of the INFIRMARY. HUEY lies th beaten and bloody. The two men LOCK EYES, each raising a FIST in salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters. The auditorium is empty except for Cleaver, Tyrone, and Little Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
dialogues.text: (shocked) Where's everybody?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: We had over a hundred people, just on the "Free Huey" Defense Committee alone until we chose a lawyer. CHARLES GARRY, a white man in a crumpled suit move across the gym floor towards them.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
dialogues.text: Can he free Huey?

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: If anybody can, he's the man. Bobby Seale SHAKES Garry's hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY SEALE
dialogues.text: (to the Panthers) Brothers the struggle has begun... We need allies and we need 'em fast. Eldridge?

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: I'm on it...

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Panther FLAGS fly -- now bearing the words "FREE HUEY." A nonstop RALLY/VIGIL of Panthers and Black Folks covers th steps. WHITE FOLKS wear "HONKIES FOR HUEY." buttons. Uniformed COPS stare out from the jail's GLASS DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black is beautiful/FREE HUEY! /Set our warrior free/FREE HUEY!/Black is beautiful/FREE HUEY/Set our warrior free... Bobby Seale stands next to Eldridge and other BLACK ACTIV near a microphone. A very intense, wiry man in sunglasses approaches the mike -- STOKELY CARMICHAEL. Carmichael's speaking style is unique, his slow low-key d underscoring the incendiary nature of the words.

dialogues.speaker: CARMICHAEL
dialogues.text: We say that Huey P. Newton is a prisoner of war. Many people say that that's not true. Or that the Party is exaggerating. I think it's clear, it's crystal clear that the United States has declared war on Black people. She did that when she took the first black man from Africa. The Crowd ROARS in approval, raising Black FISTS.

dialogues.speaker: CARMICHAEL
dialogues.text: Now of course, she never came out and said the words, "I declare war on Black people. She did not do that. Well now, the United States to this day has not declared war on Vietnam, but there is Vietnam. They did not declare war on North Korea but they fought in North Korea. And they did not declare war against the Indians. They just wiped them out. MORE applause, even non-Panthers pick up on the message.

dialogues.speaker: CARMICHAEL
dialogues.text: So we must define our position... We are at war. Huey P. Newton, Minister of Defense, is our leader. He is in jail. He is a prisoner of war. We must get him by any means necessary. If we cannot get him, we must, we must retaliate. Period. CHEERS, a CALL rises from the crowd -- plain in it's "Free Huey." Over and over again. "Free Huey."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bee hive of activity, Bobby mans the phone. Tyrone, and Judge open a BOX -- containing FREE HUEY BUTTONS. message:

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Alma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, we can't make enough of these things. We got movie stars calling up, asking how they can help. I tell you sister it's nation time...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Yeah I wish we didn't need no pins... Wish Huey was here right now...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (softly) Me too... Tyrone fixes Judge with an INQUISITIVE STARE.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: You sure about that... brother? At the door LITTLE BOBBY -- amazed -- YELLS to the others

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: Brothers!!! Sisters! Come here. This, you gotta see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOOD SIZED NEIGHBORHOOD group caries FOOD inside. OLDER MEN, kids, BOBBY HUTTON'S MOM. In the front walks RITA. Judge pushes to the front, his jaw drops. He exchanges a probing LOOK with his mom.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You all been working so much... you know. Me and some others thought you might be missing the home cooking... MRS. HUTTON taps a finger to his "Free Huey" button.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HUTTON
dialogues.text: Hey... you got any more of those. LAUGHTER rises as the Panthers usher their folks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodgers, obviously getting an earful over the phone, splu excuses and explanations.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Granted, the Free Huey thing has become a bit of a rallying cry for the left.

dialogues.speaker: HOOVER
dialogues.text: (over) Rallying cry, it's an insurrection. Seale, that god damned Cleaver, Where the hell do these guys come from?

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Well... like they say, there's a Panther born every minute in the ghetto. Uh... we seem to have "underestimated" the support of the Black community. It's their power base...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoover takes a couple moments before saying his next word

dialogues.speaker: HOOVER
dialogues.text: Well, then we're going to take that power away from those bastards.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: (over) You mean...

dialogues.speaker: HOOVER
dialogues.text: Yes, that's exactly what I mean. And Agent Rodgers?... This conversation never occurred. Hoover HANGS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN wander the decks as RODGERS and DORSETT stare off the bow at the Bay. TONY keep an eye on them from a distance. A booming

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: Rodgers this is no good.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Cut the crap, you've been taking the man's money for years. Now it's time you earned it. VOICE grabs their attention.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: (over) Gentlemen!!! Forgive me for keeping you. An immaculately dressed man -- LOUIS TRAFFICANTE -- steps  out. Smooth as silk, his every movement spells Mafia.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: Odd isn't it Chief Dorsett? No matter how much we try to deny it, we find ourselves on the same side of the coin. It's almost funny... Trafficante settles easily into a deck chair. Dorsett's looking mildly indignant.

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: To be quite honest it turns my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: Neither your stomach or your opinion matters here Dorsett... What matters is that Mr. Trafficante and the Bureau have come up with a solution to our Panther Problem. One might say...The Final Solution.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: Well put. As you and Agent Rodgers know, my organization has moved into narcotics. It was decided that this product would be confined to the ghettos. However, you and your police department has made operations in Oakland impossible. I take delivery of shipments and they sit. I -- and my associates -- lose money. Vast sums of money. Now, you have some very large problems with the Black community.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: More like a revolution. West Oakland's turning into hostile territory.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: I assure you the pacifying properties of Heroin are quite remarkable. See, junkie's politics are different from yours and mine. For them the only Party's the next fix.

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: Dealing dope... And you want the department to turn a blind eye while you turn Oakland into a city of zombies.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: Not the entire city, just one troublesome part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if it spreads to the rest of the population?

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFICANTE
dialogues.text: Relax, Chief. That will never happen. I gotta little gypsy in me. Soon the moolies gonna be too busy -- we'll sell 'em a few guns too -- blowing each others brains out over the stuff to be fucking with protests. Now I've got the product. What I need is a center of operation and someone to oversee the movement of the product. Not one of my people but a native, someone inside the community.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: I don't think that will be any problem...

dialogues.speaker: DORSETT
dialogues.text: You talk as if this thing's already been decided. Rodgers hits Dorsett with a piercing GLARE.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: It has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE and LITTLE BOBBY sit, finishing dinner as Rita bust around clearing DISHES, being a mom... In the background, the TV plays, its sound turned down.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Glad to see you boys eat like that. No wonder either you're both looking like scarecrows. Don't sleep, don't eat, ain't no way to live...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's good to be skinny, easier to run from fat cops. (his eye catching the Tv) Hey what's that? Casually, everyone glances at the television. HORROR hit RITA'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Dr. King...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE: The balcony... Abernathy, Young, Jackson POINT t where the shots came from as Dr. King bleeds on the cemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at the television. Rita has dropped a BOW on the floor. Little Bobby's face is covered with TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Oh lord, please god no. No.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: They killed him. He never hurt nobody. They killed him..

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE: America EXPLODES into riot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Panthers trot over to where THREE YOUNG MEN face a SM GROCERY. One's holding a GAS CAN.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: That's right burn the mother down. REVEREND SLOCUM steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: SLOCUM
dialogues.text: Hold on there, exactly what are you boys doing?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Sending a message... They shoot Dr King... we burn them...

dialogues.speaker: SLOCUM
dialogues.text: What good's burning our neighborhood down.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. It gets TENSE. Then a voice come from a SIDE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Brother... you best clean out your head, or we will do it for you. Turning, the young man spots a CADRE of Panthers -- Tyron Alma, and Little Bobby moving toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend's right, you burn the neighborhood, you're just doing the pig's work for him. And we sure as hell ain't gonna stand for that. Dig? Eyeing the deadly serious Panthers, the men back down.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: I dig. But how we gonna let 'em know we ain't gonna take this shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: You know where Black Panther headquarters is? You come on down there, speak your mind, listen. Organize.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (grabbing the can) Later for that... be there. Rev. Slocum gazes at the Panthers with new respect as the head off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense, angry, the PANTHERS meets. Flanked by two PANTHER BODYGUARDS, ELDRIDGE speaks pure rage.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: No more words!!! No more god damn words!! No more sitting, no more praying for the pig to stop killing us. Later for lying down. Later for waiting to get shot like dogs. Nonviolence has died in Memphis, died with Dr. King. We must retaliate. We've got the fucking guns, it's time to use them.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: Off the pig man. Off the god damn pig. Bobby Seale -- his eyes steely -- INTERRUPTS.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Brother Eldridge... I hear you. But I disagree. And we both know Huey disagrees too. Yeah, we got the guns, but the Pigs got more. The Pig has  got the National Guard. I'm not afraid to fight. But we aren't stupid either. We got to be smart, not angry.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Later for that...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (pissed) No man... later for you! What? We gonna forget Huey and his trial? Start killing pigs, start the revolution now. With our leader in jail? We do that and Huey's a dead man. We're all dead. No man, we stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: What? You giving me orders now?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Just telling you what it is.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Fuck that. It's time to intensify the struggle. That is what it is. Indignant, Eldridge storms out -- his guards follow.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (watching them leave) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Seale -- haggard, concerned -- faces HUEY under the watchful eye of a GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: You got to sit on Eldridge...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Man, El-Rage is El-Rage. You know him,

dialogues.speaker: HUEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do, but he's gotta cool it...

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: SMALL HOUSES sit quietly on this tree lined street, as... Car full of cops screeches into frame blasting ELDRIDGE f back. A couple of other Panthers scatter as Eldridge pull LITTLE BOBBY towards a house for safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELDRIDGE tumbles down STAIRS, LITTLE BOBBY right behind h They hunker down in the basement, sweating. Eldridge chec his legs -- BLOOD soaks his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALF A DOZEN police cars screech to a stop in front of th house. Cops POP up, armed to the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS tear through the room as Eldridge and Little Bobb hit the deck. It's a ferocious volley of fire, hundreds o shells pouring through the thin walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second the GUNFIRE STOPS. A SERGEANT makes a motion his men. TEAR GAS rifles appear. The COPS fire gas canisters THROUGH the basement walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke chokes the room, as Little Bobby and Eldridge, blin hacking, crawl along the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: Papa E, we got to get out of here. Eldridge THINKS for a second.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Take off your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: (undressing) Take ‘em off. Pigs ain't gonna shoot an unarmed, naked man. Where they gonna say you hid a gun.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOBBY
dialogues.text: No man I can't.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: Later for that. Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDS UP, Eldridge and Little Bobby emerge from the hous Eldridge's NAKED, Little Bobby's fully CLOTHED. Cops descend on them, grabbing them.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (pointing to a car) Go on, get in that car fuckers, and don't try nothing. Moving very slowly, Eldridge heads for the car.

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: I am not resisting arrest! ! Suddenly, a COP SHOVES Little Bobby forward. He stumbles bit, out in the open, EXPOSED. A VOLLEY of SHOTS rips through Little Bobby. Tearing him KILLING him in moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the car, Eldridge stares horrified at Little Bobb ruined body. A SERGEANT stands nearby. A COP approaches the Sergeant holding a .22 PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: He was going for this...

dialogues.speaker: ELDRIDGE
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Motherfuckers... Wham! The Sergeant PISTOL WHIPS Eldridge into unconscious The SCREEN goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposite the HUEY poster, a new IMAGE hangs -- LITTLE BOB picture. A memorial to a Panther's martyr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL CASKET lowers into the ground. Panthers pay their respects. The CROWD with JUDGE, ALMA, TYRONE, RITA, AND R SLOCUM disperses.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Little Bobby... Just a kid...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (somber) They're hurting us, baby. Huey locked  up. Bobby Seale running all over the country holding things together. Cy dead. Little Bobby... I don't recognize half the faces at meetings. Tyrone's eyes JUDGE suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: ‘Cept him... Strain showing on his face, BOBBY SEALE heads over.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Look... I gotta get on a plane tonight. Huey's trial's starting. I need you to make sure there's a strong Panther Presence there.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: What about Cleaver? You got him out on bail, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah... but well, things are too hot. Eldridge and Kathleen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone watches from the window of ELDRIDGE'S PLYMOUTH as Eldridge and Kathleen climb out of the car and into the b of an old pickup truck.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (over) ...they're gonna disappear...

dialogues.speaker: FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: The headline reads: NEWTON TRIAL BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An absolute MADHOUSE of activity, Alma, Judge and Tyrone juggle phones, fill boxes with pins. Everywhere the words FREE HUEY can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodgers and Dorsett sit facing TWO BLACK MEN, one is name SHORTY, the other we cannot see. Dorsett looks ill. He po a TUMS. BRIMMER'S there too, looking very unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: So you enjoy your little "vacation?"

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I tell you, Vegas don't have much flavor. But it was alright. Good to get back to the neighborhood though.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: That's what we wanted to talk to you about. We have a proposition for you. One that will make you the most powerful man in West Oakland... The CAMERA MOVES. We see the man Rodgers is talking to -- SABU.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'm all ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUNSET paints the water peaceful colors a night falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late as Judge lays on his bed, staring at the ceilin tortured. BOOM! Judges door flies off its hinges. BRIMMER storms in mean, drunk. He's on Judge in a second -- handcuffing him

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Hey... what the hell you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Shut up. Just shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIMMER'S CAR pulls onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apprehensive, Judge eyes Brimmer from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Brimmer what's with you man? Stone silent, Brimmer takes a deep swig from a PINT BOTTL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer's car approaches the center of the Bridge, then K GOING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge stares at Brimmer's back, relieved, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (mumbling, loaded) Twenty years asshole. Twenty years on the force. I've seen some fucked up stuff. Done some fucked up stuff... (a beat) But nothing like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brimmer's car pulls over on the shoulder past the toll bo He yanks Judge out of the car. Then UNCUFFS him.

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Go! Run! Go on! Get the fuck out of here! !

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: What? So you can shoot me? Call it resisting arrest?

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna shoot you Judge. Look... it's over. Just run away. Get out. Stay away from Oakland. Cause it's gone... it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Brimmer you're fucked up...

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'm fucked up. You're fucked up. Government's fucked up. Whole country's fucked up. You got no idea what's going on here. This is bigger than you and me. We're just little tiny soldiers getting moved around on some big asshole's desk. The Panthers... fuck you're history... they killed you and you don't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Who's they?

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: (rambling on getting into his car) Drugs Judge, they're gonna flood West Oakland with dope. Jack you up and string you out like a two dollar whore. And while the community's shuffling for a fix, they're gonna snuff every Panther they can find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? I mean besides the FBI?

dialogues.speaker: BRIMMER
dialogues.text: I don't know. Except, it's one of you. Maybe not a Panther, but it's someone from the neighborhood. Judge. Look, just go. Get away. It's over. You lost. (a beat) We all lost. Brimmer's car lumbers away, kicking up gravel. Judge -- thinking furiously -- stares after it. THE BRIDGE looms up in the background, dwarfing Judge.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Fuck that. Ain't nothing over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge WALKS across the bridge heading BACK to Oakland.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JUDGE'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Judge, weary approaches his building. He spins, startled, something moves in the alleyway. A voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Judge... Judge moves into the alley, eyes adjusting to the darknes

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Rose?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (scared... whispering) Yeah... Look man, what I gotta say. It's just you, me and the rats, right? Alright... well... Sabu's back.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Motherfuck... well then I got something to do.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No... wait, there's something else, something weird. I hear he's set up down at that warehouse on fifty deuce. He's talking big and living bigger. REALIZATION dawns on Judge.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: God damn it's him. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Judge man. Watch yourself. Sabu's got juice now.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You don't even know it man, but you're a god damn hero. Judge bolts out the alley. ROSE stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOS: Judge and HUEY TALK EARNESTLY through a GLASS PARTIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alma and Tyrone stand at the front of a huge CROWD standi vigil for HUEY'S trial.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: No more brothers in jail Off the Pig! The pigs are gonna catch hell Off the Pig! Revolution has come Off the Pig! Time to pick up the gun Off the Pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSMEN cover every available seat, frantically writing n as THE PROSECUTOR finishes examining THE WOUNDED POLICE OFFICER from the shoot-out. CHARLES GARRY, Huey's lawyer, a WHITE MAN in a rumpled su sits next to Huey, with a STRANGE smile on his face...

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: Now you say that it was Huey Newton that opened fire without any provocation What makes you so sure? It was a dark night, there was a lot of confusion.

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED COP
dialogues.text: Well, sir I was there.

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: That's right you were. (to the Jury) He was there. He saw everything. And he is not on trial. He does not need to lie to save his life. (to Garry)  Your witness.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to the Judge) If it would please the court, I would like to introduce testimony of a new witness. One who is not on trial for his life and... one who was there also. I call Gene McKinney to the stand. A MURMUR ripples through the court as Gene McKinney takes the stand. The Prosecutor goes red with rage.

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: Objection, who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: This is an eyewitness to the shooting. The passenger in Huey Newton's car.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Overruled Mr. Garry you may examine your witness.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: Mr. McKinney, were you a passenger in the car on the night of October 28, 1967.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Yes sir I was.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: And did you witness the shoot-out?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I did.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: From what you saw, did Huey Newton start the shooting?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: No sir he didn't. More MURMURING, the Prosecutor looks dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: Huh, well then... (a pause) did someone else start shooting?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: I refuse to answer the question on the grounds it might incriminate me.  The COURTROOM EXPLODES in shock and amazement.

dialogues.speaker: GARRY
dialogues.text: Did you shoot the officers in question?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Again I'll take the fifth amendment on that question. MAYHEM, the Prosecutor begins yelling. The Judge bangs hi gavel, and the jury looks very confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited, ALMA slams down a PHONE. Every set of Panther ey is on her.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: That was Garry. (smiling) He says they're gonna come back with manslaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: It means youngblood, Huey's out in less than two years. He ain't gonna get the chair. He might not be free yet, but brothers and sisters he is not going to die. A CHEER ripples through the room. Alma HUGS Tyrone.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: I gotta call Bobby... Tyrone reaches for the PHONE, it RINGS before he can pick up.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Black Panther Party.

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: (over) Congratulations asshole. Huey got off, but we just got your boy Bobby Seale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS on a highway force a PANTHER wedding caravan the road. Guns drawn, cops rip SEALE from the car, draggi him on his back toward an UNMARKED CAR.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (over) Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: RODGERS
dialogues.text: (over) The tooth fairy. And I got a present for you. Guy who helped us get Bobby His name's Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click, the line goes dead. Tyrone smacks the phone into i cradle. GRIM-FACED, Tyrone looks to ALMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something moves outside, Rose turns dropping his wine. It Sabu and Shorty. Sabu fires... killing Rose and his dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge moves into the dark, senses on alert. Something's w Suddenly he's attacked. He flips his assailant as the lig snap on. Tyrone has Judge in a choke hold, Alma has him a gun point.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Fuck is up?!

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Mothafucker! You just set Bobby Seale up to be kidnapped. They dragged him off to some bullshit conspiracy trial in Chicago. How much the pigs pay you for this one, Judge? (pulling out his gun and cocking it) Judge's HAND flies out, grabbing ahold of Tyrone's GUN HA Neither moving a muscle, Judge STARES at Tyrone.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You got it wrong. Alma, puts her 38 to Judge's face.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Let him go. And drop your piece.  Outgunned, Judge obeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO COP CARS move slowly toward Panther HQ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANGRY COP lights a cigarette as his partner drives pas Panther HQ.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY COP
dialogues.text: Can't believe that rat bastard ain't going to the chair. That Newton turd should be taken out and shot. Pointing to the WICKER POSTER, the driver SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: PARTNER
dialogues.text: How about a little target practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring at Judge, Tyrone's finger TIGHTENS on the TRIGGER

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (dead serious) You better just kill me Tyrone. And when Huey gets out, when Oakland's just wall to wall junkies, you tell him you blew away the only chance we all got. I'm sure he'll be real happy about that.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: The pigs are gonna start flooding us with dope. Huey wants us to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Tyrone hold on... BLAM!! A shot from outside shatters the window. The trio dives for cover. Another SHOT wings ALMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out front, FOUR COPS in two cars, FIRE on the OFFICE. Bul rip into the POSTERS of HUEY and LITTLE BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone, gun still on Judge, huddles on the floor. Screeching tires can be heard outside, the COPS LEAVING.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Chickenshits? What you bring your buddies with you?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: No man No!! Tyrone listen... we got to move man, they got a warehouse...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!! Alma APPEARS her left arm BLOODY.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Tyrone...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Oh shit Alma... you're...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: I'm okay... listen to me... (serious) Let's go with Judge, check it out.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: What?!? Don't tell me you're buying this? A tense moment, Alma looks from Judge to Tyrone.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I believe him. And you do too. After a moment of thought, Tyrone RISES. Then he picks up JUDGE's .45. Alma GRABS her own GUN.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Alright, but no fucking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BLACK THUGS stand on opposite sides of the warehouse doors, checking out the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYRONE - in the passenger seat, a gun on Judge -- stares the warehouse from the car. Alma, her arm ROUGHLY BANDAGE sits in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those ain't cops.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: And they sure ain't from the neighborhood. Figure Sabu's in there?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yeah with a whole load of drugs. So, you trust me now? Tyrone takes his .38 off Judge, then COCKS Judge's .45 an HANDS it to him

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Brother, I ain't got a choice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SABU is talking quietly with TRAFFICANTE's right hand man TONY. SHORTY and THREE BURLY BLACK BODYGUARDS stand nearb Suddenly Sabu hears and sound and pulls his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SHORTY
dialogues.text: Fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Check the back. Suddenly gunfire rips out. Tony disappears as Shorty gets taken down. One of the THUGS nails Tyrone in the shoulder Judge retaliates blasting him backwards.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (helping Tyrone up) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Not really. Gimme the keys for the trunk. ALMA moves shakily from the BACK SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (to Alma) Stay here, watch this door. Anybody besides me and Judge steps out kill them. Alma -- ever the soldier -- NODS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warily, Judge and Tyrone step in. Tyrone's BLEEDING heavi Judge holds a GAS CAN. It's quiet. Too quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: There it is... On a TABLE in the corner of the DARK warehouse sits BOXES VIALS and a stack of GLASSINE BAGS - filled with POWDER.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (handing the CAN over) Shut the motherfucker down. I'll find Sabu. Tyrone moves to the table. A BULLET hits him in the leg. Another rips into Judge, dropping him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: (over) You just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone drops, his GAS CAN spilling out over the floor. Judge ROLLS -- operating like a soldier -- emptying the . into the BODYGUARD #1. Sabu and the other BODYGUARDS disappear into the SHADOWS. EJECTING the clip from the .45 and slams a fresh one in. gets to his feet, LIMPING into the DARKNESS. A NOISE sounds, Judge WHIRLS firing, dropping BODYGUARD # Judge TURNS coming eye to eye with a .45, held by a very HIGH SABU.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Drop the gun Panther man. Pistol pushed against Judge's skull, Sabu moves around to Judge's side. Judge DROPS the gun.

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: All your mighty militant bullshit, man you don't know what fucking time it is do you? Dig it (holding up a bag of

dialogues.speaker: COCAINE
dialogues.text: this is power baby.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Sabu you sorry motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: SABU
dialogues.text: Sorry? Not me not now. This is my time not yours. Black Panthers? Who the fuck are you. Promising everything to everyone. Well fuck that. I got mine... Now y'all get yours... brother.  Sabu COCKS the gun. Judge SPINS, batting Sabu's gun hand away.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You ain't my fucking brother!! BULLETS tear through Sabu as TYRONE fires from the ground

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Damn straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge and Tyrone help each other up... From BEHIND a CRAT the SECOND BODYGUARD bolts toward the DOOR. GUNFIRE blares out, blasting the BODYGUARD across the roo ALMA appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Alma I told you to...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: (icy calm) Fuck that, we've got company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS pull up in front. Armed to the teeth with RIO GUNS, half a dozen COPS take up position behind the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alma -- hidden in the shadows -- watches the windows. Beh her. Tyrone -- BADLY HURT -- leans against the wall next her. Behind them Judge finishes pouring out the GAS CAN.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Judge... hurry! Throwing that can away, Judge SMILES at Tyrone.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Hey, brother you got a match? GUN SHOTS rip through the walls as the cops OPEN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riot Guns pour lead into the building a la the Fred Hampt massacre. Today, the police are taking no prisoners. Behind the POLICE, RODGERS watches the mayhem, SHAKING hi head. Whatever the outcome, the operation's OVER. Alone, WALKS back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone CRAWLS across the floor, leaving a trail of BLOOD toward Judge and Alma.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (hurt bad) Look... You... take her and get the hell out of here. I'll keep ‘em busy.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: (to Judge) You gotta. You gotta stay alive. You know what they were trying to do here. You got the pigs dead to rights. It's like Huey said, you're more important than any of us.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: We'll all get out of here together.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Later for that. I'm done either way... Another BARRAGE of bullets rips through the walls. One GR Tyrone's ARM. His GUN slides across the floor. The PISTOL settles ominously in front of Alma. She looks over it at Tyrone. Their eyes LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE
dialogues.text: Go... Click! Clack! Faster than a thought, Alma checks, clears COCKS the pistol. She HANDS it to Tyrone. Tragic understa flows between them. Grabbing the pistol, Tyrone SCOOTS across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Tyrone!!! Near the door, Tyrone turns to Judge and raises his fist.

dialogues.speaker: TYRONE,
dialogues.text: Power to the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAMES leaping up behind him, TYRONE, pure defiance, step  out and FACES the cops. The IMAGE FREEZES. GUNFIRE cuts through the air. The mome is frozen, in time, in history, in legend. Slowly, the IM dissolves. Fading into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSED over the WAREHOUSE FLAMES, the bullet-riddle posters of HUEY and LITTLE BOBBY stare out, like a legacy or a warning. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONCRETE, cracked and dirty, fills the frame. A SMALL FOO steps onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STOPLIGHT hangs at the once deadly intersection. SCHOOL KIDS wait at the corner. The light CHANGES and they step safely into the street.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (over) The community got the streetlight... finally. But the way I see it...

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (over) The struggle continues...
